text: Huoshan Huangya tea (; pronounced ) is a yellow tea from Huoshan County of Anhui Province in China. It is an imperial tribute tea, that dates back to the Ming Dynasty. The dry tea leaves have a shiny appearance and are very similar to Huang Shan Mao Feng tea. When steeped, the tea has a very peppery and fresh taste as well as an unusual green-yellow color. As with most bud teas, the color and fragrance are slight. ==References== * The Harney & Sons Guide to Tea . Category:Yellow tea Category:Chinese teas Category:Chinese tea grown in Anhui
title: Huoshan Huangya tea
